pros: I worked in the Math Lab at MVCC as a Professional Tutor and it was one of the best jobs I've ever worked. The people in the Learning Commons are so knowledgeable and so happy and willing to help anybody and everybody. It really is an amazing environment.
cons: For part time employees they cap hours at 29 per week. So if you're looking for full time hours, you may need to take on a couple of hours at a second job.

review_title: good job if your not looking to get rich.
pros: relaxed working conditions easy paced job.
cons: civil service contract. raises are equal no matter how well you work.

pros: Freedom due to the lack of support.
cons:
I've taught as an adjunct for 8 years at five colleges across upstate and MVCC was by far the most difficult teaching experience each and every semester. 

There's a lack of support for new employees at every level. You won't be able to sign a contract until the semester starts which means there's no guarantee on your employment.  Look forward to having your class cancelled or reassigned to a full timer.

There's reasons why they are continuously hiring adjuncts...
low income, too far from home
There are many toxic people. A lot of people who do not work well together and tear each other down .

pros: Absolutely 0 pros. This place is a joke.
cons: As a full-time instructor you have 2 roles that they will never mention until you get hired- 1. Full-time faculty and 2. Full-time academic counselor.  In addition to teaching you are required to carry a load of 80+ students who you will advise with career choice and create education plans and also teach a full course load. The pay is the lowest I have ever seen in higher education (k-12 teachers get paid more) and the union is extremely weak so don't waste your money. Its an okay start for someone with no teaching experience but its not a place you can make a career. Its a stepping stone to another community college- a REAL community college. The administration is full of men and if you are a person of color watch out because they will make it difficult for you and set you up to fail. The college is run like a for-profit and not a community college. Whatever the Administrator wants goes and don't bother questioning or they will set you up to be fired. MVCC is the most unprofessional, and pathetic community college in NY. You have been warned. RUN!!!

review_title: Great Environment, Little Room for Growth
pros: Great coworkers, great attitudes, make my own schedule, love the students, recent pay raises (2018) beyond min wage dependent on your education level.
cons: Very little opportunities or encouragement for promotion or position changes. The Learning Commons does not want their tutors to leave, so it's hard to move up.

review_title: Okay employment but no room for growth
pros: Many of the professors and students are great.
cons: The pay leaves something to be desired. No real room for growth. No pay increases and part-time employees receive no benefits.

pros:
Wonderful staff, great environment, friendly,
Employee Institutes 2x yearly for fun and information
cons:
Salaray and positions are mainly part-time and contingent upon enrollment/funding.
Hiring status for many jobs dependent upon degree completion instead of experience or credits.

pros: Motivated lab hours, time to do home work, helps your memory by helping other students with their work, quiet.
cons: None, this is a pretty good job for students. Just remember to bring your lunch and a snack!!!

job_title: Airframe and Power plant in Rome, NY
pros: very efficient, and dedicate it person.
Most departments have a collaborative positive culture
cons: Not all departments are collaborative. Some faculty set in their ways.

review_title: Some department lack unity and collaboration
cons: Not all departments are as collaborative and team oriented.

pros: Enjoy education field, small classroom and campus feel.
cons: Minimal to no support from administration
